name: Sumanth Tangirala
qualifications: Robotics PhD Student, PRACSYS Lab - Rutgers University
about: Primary Areas of Focus: <yellow_bold>Robotics, Safe and Verifiable Motion Planning.</yellow_bold>

Pursuing a PhD thesis under Professor Kostas Bekris, focusing on <yellow_bold> safety verification of robot policies </yellow_bold> and <yellow_bold> safe kinodynamic motion planning </yellow_bold> for high-dynamics robots.

skills.title: Machine & Deep Learning
skills.description: I have over five years of extensive experience in ML and DL, applying these in Computer Vision, Robotics, and NLP projects with PyTorch and TensorFlow

skills.title: Reinforcement Learning
skills.description: I've spent the past year focusing on Reinforcement Learning for robot motion planning, primarily using PPO and SAC-HER at the PRACSYS lab

skills.title: Robot Operating System
skills.description: In my current research, I use ROS for robot control and navigation, including developing a perception system for PRACSYS Lab's MuSHR platform

skills.title: Physics Simulation Engines
skills.description: My current work extensively involves using MuJoCo and NVIDIA IsaacGym for environments to simulate robots and develop robot controllers

skills.title: Python, C++
skills.description: With over seven years of expertise in Python and C++, I have applied these programming languages in diverse projects spanning various fields

skills.title: CUDA, Parallel Programming
skills.description: I have used CUDA C++ to parallelize image segmentation from scratch and have also used it on a high-level to accelerate the training of neural networks.

timeline.title: Rutgers University & PRACSYS Lab
timeline.desc: Ph.D. student in Computer Science researching robot motion planning at the PRACSYS Lab. Completed M.S. in Computer Science (2022–2024) and currently pursuing doctoral research (2024–present).

timeline.title: Zoox Inc.
timeline.desc: I am working in the Offline Driving Intelligence team, developing prediction and safety verification methods for autonomous vehicles

timeline.title: Tekion Corp.
timeline.desc: Starting with a Winter 2020 software engineering internship and advancing to a full-time role as Software Engineer, I developed significant frontend components for a leading Dealership Management System.

timeline.title: Indian Space Research Organization
timeline.desc: During a Summer Internship, I developed a time-series Machine Learning technique for accurate land cover classification using satellite imagery and this tool continues to be used by ISRO in their ongoing projects

timeline.title: DA-IICT
timeline.desc: Completed B.Tech in Information and Communication Technology and served as a Research Assistant at the Smart City Lab focusing on PolSAR image segmentation and classification using Deep Learning techniques.

projects.title: Obstacle Navigation with a Robot Dog
longDesc: Trained a two-fold controller policy for a robot dog to navigate an environment with obstacles simulated in NVIDIA IsaacGym

The first policy was trained to reach velocity goals by providing torques to the 12 joints of the robot dog and the second policy was trained to provide appropriate velocities to the robot dog to reach the goal
Used NVIDIA IsaacGym to simulate a Unitree Go1 robot in a 3D environment with obstacles
Trained the controller policies using PyTorch, an Actor-Critic network and Proximal Policy Optimization to navigate the robot in the environment
Implemented a custom reward function to encourage the robot to avoid obstacles and reach the goal

projects.title: GPU Parallelization of Fuzzy Image Segmentation
longDesc: Designed and implemented a GPU parallelized strategy for the Fuzzy Simple Linear Iterative Clustering (SLIC) algorithm
Achieved a 200x speedup over the sequential version of the algorithm for a 2K Image using CUDA on an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti

projects.title: Mobile Robot Social Navigation
longDesc: Built a simulation environment and a collision detection algorithm for the Multi-agent System for non-Holonomic Racing (MuSHR) platform with obstacles using MuJoCo
Used the Reciprocal Velocity Obstacle (RVO) algorithm to come up with a controller for the MuSHR platform capable of navigating and reaching goals while avoiding other agents and obstacles

Demonstrated the limitations of the RVO algorithm in complex environments with multiple agents and obstacles and proposed a prediction-based hierarchical planning approach to overcome these limitations

projects.title: Just Walk Out Shopping
longDesc: Developed a prototype for an automated shopping system inspired by Amazon Go that uses sensors and an in-store communication network to track customers and their purchases
Due to a limitation placed by the advisor on the use of cameras and computer vision, I used a combination of sensors to track customers and their purchases
Customers could pick up NFC bands at the entrance of the store and tap their phone on the band to identify themselves on the system
Customers could then pick up products and each aisle processor would use a combination of LIDAR and pressure sensors to quantity the product and use RFID readers to identify the customer
The aisle processor, an Arduino, would then communicate with the main processor hub, a Raspberry Pi, through the Zigbee network to update the customer's cart
The customer could then drop their NFS band in a dropbox which would detect exited customer to digitally checkout their purchase and charge the customer

projects.title: Land Cover Classification using GeoSpatial Imagery
longDesc: Dual-Polarized SAR imagery techniques for land cover classification are limited and Fully-Polarimetric SAR images are not available for all regions
During a Summer Internship at the Indian Space Research Organization, I worked on filling this gap by developing a land cover classification technique using a Dual-Polarized SAR imagery
As a part of the internship, my advisor and I surveyed farmlands in the area of Junagadh, Gujarat, India to collect ground truth data for the project
This area predominantly has farmlands of Cotton and Groundnut, and information about the crop type and harvest days is crucial for the government to make informed decisions about the area
I developed a time-series Machine Learning technique that used Dual-Polarized SAR imagery of the region and the ground truth data for accurate land cover classification
The technique used a Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) to learn the time-series patterns in the SAR imagery and a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to learn the spatial patterns in the imagery
The technique achieved an accuracy of 91.2% for the classification of Cotton and Groundnut crops
The technique continues to be used by ISRO in their ongoing projects

projects.title: Autonomous Environmental Logging IoT System
longDesc: Developed an end-to-end IoT solution that acted as an external unit for the ELM7 environmental logging sensor developed by the WIMS2 Lab at the University of Michigan
This work was a part of a collaborative project between WIMS2 and Smart City Lab, DAIICT, and my work was advised by Dr. Yogesh Gianchandani, Director of WIMS2 Lab, University of Michigan
The sensor was aimed to measure environmental parameters in remote dangerous locations such as mines and the end-to-end system was aimed to provide a way to monitor such sites remotely
The system consisted of a gateway in the form of a Raspberry Pi, a cloud server and a client-side desktop GUI
The Raspberry Pi was connected to the ELM7 sensor through Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocol and the cloud server was connected to the Raspberry Pi through a WiFi network
The GUI was developed using Tkinter and was responsible for sending control commands to the Raspberry Pi and displaying the data received from the sensor

The Raspberry Pi was responsible for receiving controls and operating in one of the three modes - Single, Batch and Continuous - where the mode determined the frequency of data collection. This data would then be relayed to the cloud server with a frequency determined by the mode
The cloud server was developed using NodeJS and was responsible for storing the data and providing it to the web application on request

projects.title: External Perception System for Autonomous Robot Navigation
longDesc: Contributed to development of an external perception system in the PRACSYS lab for the MuSHR platform to enable training of closed-loop control policies for mobile robots
Used AprilTags to localize the robot and the boundaries in the environment which were then processed using OpenCV to estimate the pose and location of the robot and the boundaries
Built Robot Operating System (ROS) services to communicate the location of the robot and the boundaries to the robot
Developed the system in C++ for efficiency to achieve an optimal message rate of 30+Hz

projects.title: Summary Bot
longDesc: Led a team of 10 students as Project Manager to develop a multi-platform application that can summarize long text passages and email threads using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques
Split the project into 4 modules - NLP, Android, Web Development. Assigned each module a lead and a team of 2-3 students. I personally led the NLP module
Conducted weekly scrum meetings among module leads for a collaborative development environment and managed the project using Agile methodology
The NLP module was developed using Tensorflow and NLTK and used a combination of extractive and abstractive summarization techniques to summarize long text passages
The Android module was developed using React Native and the Web module was developed using ReactJS with Firebase used as the backend for both modules
Received the Best Project Award out of 30+ projects in the Software Engineering course

projects.title: Protego - Safe Transit Planner
longDesc: This project was developed as a part of the AngelHack Bangalore 2018 and was one of the 5 projects selected for the final round

Inspired by a late night drive through a shady part of Bangalore before the day of the hackathon, my team and I developed a mobile application that uses Machine Learning to suggest safe routes to the user

The Machine Learning application used historical crime data to predict the safety of a discretized map of the city and the mobile application used this data to suggest routes built with waypoints in safe regions of the city using a A* search algorithm with the safety score as the heuristic
The mobile application was developed using Android and used the Google Maps API to generate the routes from the waypoints

projects.title: Playlist Porter
longDesc: Faced with the problem of switching from Saavn, an Indian music streaming service, developed a web scraping project to port playlists from Saavn to other music streaming services such as YouTube and Spotify
The script uses Selenium WebDriver to automate the process of logging into the user's YouTube and Spotify accounts and BeautifulSoup 4 to scrape the playlists from the user's accounts
The hope is to then extend the script to port playlists from other music services such as Spotify and Apple Music

projects.title: Parallelized Shell Media Player
longDesc: Developed as a way to experiment with Parallelism in Python, this project is a cross-platform music player that can play playlists from Saavn, an Indian music streaming service, on YouTube
The application consists of a scraper process, a player process and a controller process which communicate using Pipes
The controller process waits for command line inputs from the user and sends the appropriate commands to the player and scraper processes

The scraper processes waits for inputs on playlists to play and uses BeautifulSoup4 to automate the process of logging into the user's Saavn account and BeautifulSoup 4 to scrape the playlist from the user's account to forward a list of songs to the player process
The player process then uses the Selenium Webdriver to play the received songs and also processes the commands from the controller process to pause, play, skip and stop the playlist

projects.title: P2P File Sharing (Work in Progress)
longDesc: This project is an attempt to learn about Peer-to-Peer (P2P) networks and replicate the functionality of BitTorrent. This project is also an attempt to develop a completely decentralized P2P network (if such a thing is possible)
The application will allow users to share files with other users on the same network and also search for files on the network and download them

skills.title: Internet of Things
skills.description: Over the last four years, I've developed IoT-based solutions, including an autonomous environmental logging system and a Amazon-Go prototype.

skills.title: ReactJS, Javascript
skills.description: I have developed web applications and websites using ReactJS and Javascript. My most notable projects are this website and my work at Tekion Corp.

skills.title: Computer Vision, OpenCV
skills.description: My studies in Computer Vision have been applied in Robotics and IoT projects, notably in developing a perception system for the MuSHR platform
